arts.ttl: Daily Schmankerl: The aftermath of Bayern Munich vs. Bayer Leverkusen in the Champions League; Hugo Ekitike, Hugo Larsson to leave Eintracht Frankfurt?; Former star says Bayern’s patience wearing thin with Joshua Kimmich; and MORE!
arts.sum: In what might have been the most dominant showing against a good team under Vincent Kompany, the Bavarians were in complete control of the match from start to finish, which seemed to leave Bayer Leverkusen completely dumbfounded about how it went from not losing to Bayern Munich in the three previous matches to getting hammered. Bayern Munich hosted Bayer Leverkusen in leg one of the Champions League Round of 16 and blasted the visitors with a 3-0 victory.

arts.ttl: “Not the time for praise” — Vincent Kompany pushes Bayern Munich onward after Champions League win over Leverkusen
arts.sum: Managing motivation is not easy over the course of the season but Kompany seemed to have his men dialed in for this one. Of course the guys can be happy, but we’ll switch our focus to Bochum and then to Tuesday,” Kompany said after the match (as captured by @iMiaSanMia ).

arts.ttl: Bayern Munich vs. VfL Bochum: 2024/25 Bundesliga full coverage
arts.sum: Check out these results over VfL Bochum’s last four games: The Bavarians are still banged up and could be looking ahead to the chance to put away Bayer Leverkusen next week, but they should be aware that VfL Bochum has gotten its act together.

arts.ttl: Leverkusen need Alonso miracle to stage comeback vs. Bayern
arts.sum: An Architect of the "Miracle in Istanbul" in 2005, Xabi Alonso will need more magic if his Leverkusen are to overturn Bayern's 3-0 aggregate lead.

arts.ttl: Bavarian Podcast Works — Postgame Show: Bayern Munich 3-0 Bayer Leverkusen (Champions League)
arts.sum: Be sure to stay tuned to Bavarian Podcast Works for all of your up to date coverage on Bayern Munich and Germany. Let’s talk about how it all went down and more on the Bavarian Podcast Works — Postgame Show.

arts.ttl: Match Awards from Bayern Munich’s emphatic 3-0 win over Bayer Leverkusen in the Champions League
arts.sum: As good as Bayern’s defense was tonight, Davies definitely deserves the award. Bayern Munich fired off three unanswered goals tonight, and moves to the next leg against Bayer Leverkusen with full confidence.

arts.ttl: Vincent Kompany reflects on Bayern's win over Leverkusen, gives Neuer update
arts.sum: Vincent Kompany has given his thoughts on Bayern's win over Bayer Leverkusen and provided an update on Manuel Neuer's injury.

arts.ttl: Xabi Alonso: "A lot went against us, but that was our own fault"
arts.sum: Bayer Leverkusen only have themselves to blame for their 3-0 defeat to Bayern in the Champions League, according to Xabi Alonso.

arts.ttl: Kimmich opens up on contract talks: "The ball is not in my court!"
arts.sum: "The ball is not in my court," Joshua Kimmich said when commenting on his contract talks with FC Bayern following Wednesday's win over Bayer Leverkusen.

arts.ttl: Kane scores twice as Bayern comfortably beat Leverkusen
arts.sum: Bayern Munich cruise to a comfortable 3-0 win against 10-man Bayer Leverkusen thanks to two goals from Harry Kane in the first leg of their last-16 tie in the Champions League.
